caption.title: Effects of X-NA-X virus serial passages on virus fitness and segment 6 incorporation.
caption.p: ( a) X-NA- X viruses were passaged in MDCK cells at a controlled low m.o.i. (10 −5 pfu/cell). For each passage, supernatants were collected at day three post-infection, and virus titres were determined. Ten serial passages were performed for each virus. For M-NA- M and NP-NA- NP, one or two additional independent serial passages were performed, respectively. ( b) Incorporation of segment 6 at passage 10. The NA segment vRNA level was evaluated by specific two-step RT-qPCR 19. Results were expressed as relative amounts calculated using the 2 −ΔΔCt method with NA-NA- NA as virus reference and segment M as segment reference. ( c) For the HA-NA- HA and PB1-NA- PB1 viruses, ten additional passages were performed and virus titres determined as in a (left panel). The level of segment 6 incorporation was evaluated at passage 20 as described in b (right panel).
